programme.title: Dateline
programme.desc: A young Iowa man is shot dead in his bed in the middle of the night, asleep next to his fiancée. Bizarre coincidences and quick thinking lead to a surprising answer about who wanted him dead and why.

programme.title: Good Bones
programme.desc: Mina and Karen work to gut a condo and make it a dream home for Mina's sister and her two girls. The remodel includes personalized touches, including a special mural made by Mina, Karen and the kids.

programme.title: Good Bones
programme.desc: Mina and Karen are in Old Southside, but this time they're working in a transitional area. They've purchased a duplex of townhomes that will need both sides renovated, but for now they're focusing on the left side.

programme.title: Good Bones
programme.desc: Mina and Karen are headed back to their old stomping grounds in the Fountain Square neighborhood, to tackle a charming old bungalow. They bought the property from a couple who lived there for more than 50 years and knew it would be taken care of.

programme.title: Good Bones
programme.desc: Mina and Karen are back in Old Southside renovating the right side of their duplex townhomes. Karen also has a major announcement about her position within the company and the ramifications of that change come to light sooner than expected.

programme.desc: A couple has lived in their California home for 11 years, but now they've received a dream job offer in Georgia, where they have family ties. With their house under contract, these perfectionists must find a home that meets their needs in two days.

programme.title: House Hunters
programme.desc: While a former Marine is not willing to compromise on what she wants for a home in her adopted city of New Orleans, her Navy buddy is along for the ride to make sure she doesn't fixate on minor details and overlook the big picture.

programme.title: One Week To Sell
programme.desc: Watch this special sneak peek as Taylor Spellman tackles a four bedroom home from the 1980s in Linden, New Jersey. She hopes to add visual interest to the boring, cookie-cutter rooms by creating custom pieces and using bold pops of color.

programme.title: House Hunters
programme.desc: A man wants to honor his and his fiancee's Armenian culture and purchase a house before they marry. They both like the vibe of pricy, upscale neighborhoods, but his hard-bargaining ways have stretched their house hunt and put their wedding plans on hold.

programme.desc: A job opportunity leads a couple to relocate and search for a home in London. He wants a place that's located in Central London and wants to save money for travel, but she's anxious about the move and wants a larger home for visiting family and friends.

programme.desc: Newlyweds agree they need to buy their first home in Denver, Colorado before they can adopt dogs again, but she insists on move-in ready, while he wants as many projects as possible.

programme.desc: A military family that's used to moving with little notice receives his latest post orders. They hope to find a forever home in Georgia where they can settle down when he retires in six years.

programme.desc: A young family has outgrown their home, but major exterior issues and a dark interior are keeping it from being sold. Leslie and Lyndsay brighten and repair the outdated rambler, but pricing it right will be difficult with no comps in the neighborhood.

programme.title: Unsellable Houses
programme.desc: A couple that's desperate to sell their bungalow after receiving no offers calls on real estate experts and twins Leslie and Lyndsay. The home needs some love to make it sellable, but the stakes are raised when the twins invest money to make improvements.

programme.title: Unsellable Houses

programme.title: Unsellable Houses

programme.title: Unsellable Houses

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has finally secured a buyer for the '48 GMC truck. He's a truck nut who wants to finish the build properly, with a color change, custom trim and new interior design. Hopefully, the guys can pick up right where they left off.

programme.desc: Larry visits and gets excited by the advancement of his two projects: a 1948 Delahaye 135MS Cabriolet and a custom Mercury.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: After three years of sitting around Dave gets to work fixing up a 1972 Bronco he purchased to build and sell. Justin thinks Dave needs to rethink his color choices, while Nick struggles to get the engine purring.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony and Lucky perform a complete suspension upgrade on the most iconic 1957 Chevy of all time, Project X.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: We decide to upgrade all the necessary things to make our 1966 Fury Wagon, which is housing a 512ci V-8, safe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe has big plans for one of his favorite cars, a '64 Lincoln Continental. He wants it long and low and the color of snow. But a faulty steering column and a close call in the shop threatens to turn this quick flip into a never-ending money pit.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The owners of a run down '63 Grumman bread truck want it transformed into the ultimate t-shirt vending machine. Bill and the guys drop the giant truck to the floor with custom body modifications and a bar themed interior.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve try to revive a 1975-ish Dodge pickup whose engine has been rotting outside since Ronald Reagan was president. When the adventure starts, they have no clue if the 360 small block can be saved.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve had a blast getting an old Dodge 360 running and driving in a gutted old truck. Now they want to jerk that engine and transplant it into a '70 Challenger that has been off the road since at least 1989.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve try to revive a 1967 Jeep J100 panel truck from Rick Pewe's backyard. The goal is to finish in time to drive the newly-named Flannel Wagon up to the land speed races at El Mirage Lake, before heading out off-road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The '74 Chevy Muscle Truck is back, this time for a mini-makeover in preparation for the 2016 Hot Rod Power Tour. The goal will be improved highway cruising while preserving the stepside's massive burnout capability.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve attack a Jeep Scrambler that's been in the Freiburger fleet for about 20 years. They pull it out of hiding, spiff up some mechanical glitches, and head out for some hard-core rock-crawling adventures.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve build up a cool, vintage body style by adding extra doors to a 1966 Chevelle they picked up for $1,000. It's all about fast and cheap trying to get this muscle car out for some sideways action on a dirt oval.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crew Cab Chevelle is back for some basic suspension upgrades. Once complete, it goes head-to-head on the autocross with Lucky Costa's '66 two-door daily driver, with its LS engine, six-speed transmission and trick suspension.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crop Duster is a back-to-basics street and strip machine with big-block power. It's running its quickest quarter mile ever, running in the 11s in no-prep track conditions.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: For no good reason, David has always wanted to drive a Pontiac Bonneville to the Bonneville Salt Flats. Steve picks up a 1967 station wagon, and the two are on the road, arriving in Utah to a big surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: For years, David has had designs on making a daily driver out of a 1971 Plymouth Road Runner from the Steve Dulcich Dog Farm. A previous repaint has turned to chalk, and he has to do something about the tiny tires.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys attempt a three-day overhaul of the 351 Cleveland engine from a '67 Mercury Cougar that was once Freiburger's. The 'rebuild' is not exactly kosher, but it's dirt cheap and generates good tire smoke.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David, Steve and a '70 Plymouth Duster return to the drag strip in search of the elusive 11-second quarter mile. The car has a new 500-horsepower 383, and the guys are ready to attack their demons and have fun in the process.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Don Heidt has been scouring the country for a rare 1952 Pontiac that he wants Dave Kindig to turn into a Bitchin Ride. He's finally found one, but as the guys dig into the car they find something lurking beneath the metal that threatens the whole build.

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Andy has proven that he knows how to run his junkyard and custom car shop empire, but his risk-taking skills may have run out. He can't be at both shops at the same time so he's going to have to rely on his employees and father to pick up the slack.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A returning client is back with another classic, a 1965 Mustang Fastback. He likes to keep a stock look, but with updated drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible. Plus, the assembly team gets a crash course in engine turning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang to compete in the Optima Challenge. His build includes a new front facia and hood and a redesign for the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang is ready for paint and final assembly, but proves to one of the most intricate cars the shop has ever built.

programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette gets complicated. Plus, the owner of a Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony is building a 1972 `Cuda, dubbed 'Fishtail,' into a Drift Muscle car to be featured at the 2016 SEMA show. This first FishTail episode covers the design and fabrication of a completely custom suspension system using a full inventory of QA1 parts.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa complete the hustle of all hustles to get the 1972 'Cuda drift car, Fishtail 'Cuda, to the SEMA show on time, despite limited shop time, parts mix-ups, and even a flood in Los Angeles trying to keep the guys down.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and his gang serve up some West Coast cool, resurrecting a 1953 Ford Ranch wagon and turning it into a bad-ass beach cruiser. A heart stopping shop accident and a race to repaint a client's custom built bike could turn this dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A big Impala guy from Houston wants to take the old shell of a '66 C-10 and combine it with the best of a 60's Impala. It's a one of a kind, from the ground up build with a completely hand-built chassis, body mods, 6.2L engine, and a hydraulic bed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: Dave and KevDogg keep the pressure on, as the remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature. Teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: The competition is quickly getting more difficult. Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment, navigating a tricky exhaust challenge, with the losing team having to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: The day's first exercise is to take an hour and see if they are more of a Dave or Kev artist. Next, project managers are chosen from the group and tasked to lead a team to design and execute a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: It's every contestant for themselves now, starting with a rusted out, dented fender that needs repair. At the last minute, Dave and Kev throw a major-league curveball after they decide that the challenge is a little too easy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design. Even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp
programme.desc: Dave challenges the remaining three players to fabricate a grill from design to execution. The winners will get a spot in the finale.

programme.title: Bitchin' Bootcamp

programme.title: Phantom Signals
programme.desc: When two experts build their own radio-listening station to intercept the secret communications of American and Soviet astronauts, they capture traces of a haunting voice that may be a lost Russian cosmonaut. New, declassified evidence reveals the truth.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie hires a new driver but ends up needing rescuing after he crashes Bruce's legendary blue truck. Jamie's stepson Brandon plans to join the Alberta team and is forced to prove himself. Rookie, Colin, learns how tough Adam can be.

programme.desc: Kenae' was already big before her weight gain took off after the death of her beloved mother. Refusing to deal with the pain, Kenae' turned to food to fill the void. But she'll be reunited with her mom soon if the denial continues.

programme.desc: Learning she needs to lose 30 lbs to be eligible for bottom surgery, Jazz commits to losing weight. Later, Jazz and Jeanette participate in a debate over controversial research that suggests children shouldn't be placed on hormone blockers before puberty.

programme.desc: Crystal has been eating household cleanser every day since she was twelve. Samantha tans up to three times daily.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction
programme.desc: Jillian has been addicted to smelling pine cleaner for two years and can't go more than 15 minutes without a fix. Meanwhile, Scott is obsessed with picking up dead animals from the road.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction
programme.desc: Lauren used to be addicted to drugs and alcohol, but now she's addicted to extreme bodybuilding. Rhonda, 24, can't stop sucking her thumb.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction
programme.desc: Meet Kyle, 31, who exclusively dates women over the age of 65 and Adam who is intent upon becoming Madonna.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction
programme.desc: A woman admits to being addicted to eating half a roll of toilet paper a day.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction
programme.desc: Lacey, a 44-year-old mother of six, has had at least 30 plastic surgery procedures and spent more than $250,000 building the most extreme body in the world.

programme.title: I Am Jazz
programme.desc: Jazz and her family head to NYC for a vacation and surgical consultation. While the family enjoys the sights and rafting, Jazz fears she may need to undergo a painful procedure.

programme.title: I Am Jazz
programme.desc: Jazz explores dating girls and agrees to hang out with a potential female love interest. Jazz and Jeanette meet with Jazz's therapist for the therapy letter needed for Jazz's bottom surgery.

programme.title: OutDaughtered
programme.desc: The Busbys plan a very special Thanksgiving, but bad news for Mimi may throw the holiday into turmoil. When Adam and Danielle find out that Riley and Parker are moving up to a different classroom, Adam struggles with the idea of separating the quints.

programme.title: OutDaughtered
programme.desc: The Busbys return to the world of potty training, determined to succeed this time. Blayke takes gymnastics lessons spends some one-on-one time with her parents. Mimi distances herself from the family, struggling with the loss of her house.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Devon has come with her fiancé, Duane Brown, and Taya is engaged to Adam Koets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Farmer bride Katie's stylist sister convinced Katie to ditch her jeans and cowboy boots for a wedding gown for her special day. Courtney's looking for a flashy ball gown. Jennifer vowed to lose a lot of weight, so she ordered her dress a size too small.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle wants to find the perfect dress for her wedding; Deshae is a Southern belle who's all about glitz, beads and sparkle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, Kody finally presents to his family his pitch for all four wives to live in one big house. Janelle actually likes the idea, but Christine is dead set against it. Merry Christmas.

programme.title: Sister Wives

programme.title: Long Island Medium

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa goes to Fire Island and conducts one of the most powerful group readings of her life. Later, Theresa and Larry confront their issues have a devastating conversation about the future of their marriage.

programme.title: Long Island Medium

programme.title: Long Island Medium

programme.title: Long Island Medium

programme.title: Long Island Medium
